Name: AppName
Comment: (Required) Base package name (e.g 7zip) (Remove ! Character which hides sample apps)

Name: AppVersion
Comment: (Optional) Package version. Whole numbers beginning with 100. Nothing to do with product version. (e.g. 100 for 7zip-v100) (Recommended)

Name: AppInstaller
Comment: (Required) winget,choco,exe,msi,ps1,cmd. If winget, choco is used, leave AppUninstallName blank unless you want to uninstall an additional app

Name: AppInstallName
Comment: (Required) winget appid (case sensitive) or choco appid or filename of .exe or .msi or .ps1 or .cmd (wildcard OK). See https://winstall.app or https://community.chocolatey.org/packages for package ids.

Name: AppInstallArgs
Comment: (Optional) Prefix with ARGS: Installer arguments for msi,ps1,exe,cmd (for msi usually /quiet or /q /norestart) (for ps1 with multi param try -var1 xyz -var2 pdq named format, else entire value is first param )

Name: AppDescription
Value: Set corporate background (Windows wallpaper) and color.
Comment: (Required) Info for company portal

Name: AppUninstallName
Comment: (Optional) AddRemove Program Name (winget id - see winget list). App to uninstall (also done prior to install). This is in addition to the normal choco,winget uninstall. Uses winget to uninstall (winget list myproductid -e)

Name: AppUninstallVersion
Comment: (Optional) AddRemove Product version below which to Uninstall (e.g. 4.5.0). Detection: versions below this will not be considered Detected. Blank=Any version is detected. Use this to repackage an app to upgrade everyone to latest version.

Name: AppUninstallProcess
Comment: (Optional) Processes to end prior to uninstall. Acrob* style will work but better if no * is used. Show running names via powershell: get-process -Name Acrob*

Name: SystemOrUser
Comment: (Required) System to install as system, User to install as user

Name: Publisher
Comment: (Required) Info for company portal

Name: RestartBehavior
Comment: Allow Installer to Restart (Default is allow)

Name: Developer
Comment: Info for company portal

Name: Owner
Comment: Info for company portal

Name: Notes
Comment: Info for company portal

Name: InformationURL
Comment: Info for company portal

Name: PrivacyURL
Comment: Info for company portal

Name: CompanyPortalFeaturedApp
Comment: (Required) Company Portal Featured (Default is FALSE)

Name: AvailableInCompanyPortal
Comment: (Required) Company Portal Availability (Default is TRUE)

Name: PublishToOrgGroup
Comment: (Required) When uploaded to Intune, the PublishToGroup values from the AppsPublish_OrgList.csv will be used to push this to the existing org-wide Group as a required app. False means do not publish. Apps are always published to its own Intune WindowsApp XYZ group (Default is FALSE)

Name: CreateExcludeGroup
Comment: (Optional) When app is published, create both Include and Exclude groups specific to the app. (Default is FALSE)

Name: AppVar1
Comment: Custom var useable by ps1 files

Name: AppVar2
Comment: Custom var useable by ps1 files

Name: AppVar3
Comment: Custom var useable by ps1 files

Name: AppVar4
Comment: Custom var useable by ps1 files

Name: AppVar5
Comment: Custom var useable by ps1 files
